041package org.jfree.chart.axis;
042
043import org.jfree.chart.api.PublicCloneable;
044import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleEdge;
045import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleInsets;
046import org.jfree.chart.event.AxisChangeEvent;
047import org.jfree.chart.internal.Args;
048import org.jfree.chart.internal.SerialUtils;
049import org.jfree.chart.plot.Plot;
050import org.jfree.chart.text.TextUtils;
051import org.jfree.chart.util.AttrStringUtils;
052import org.jfree.data.Range;
053
054import java.awt.*;
055import java.awt.font.LineMetrics;
056import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
057import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
058import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
059import java.io.IOException;
060import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
061import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
062import java.io.Serializable;
063import java.util.List;
064import java.util.Objects;
065
066/**
067 * The base class for axes that display value data, where values are measured
068 * using the {@code double} primitive.  The two key subclasses are
069 * {@link DateAxis} and {@link NumberAxis}.
070 */
071public abstract class ValueAxis extends Axis
072        implements Cloneable, PublicCloneable, Serializable {
073
074    private transient ValueAxisProduct valueAxisProduct = new ValueAxisProduct();
075
076        /** For serialization. */
077    private static final long serialVersionUID = 3698345477322391456L;
078
079    /** The default axis range. */
080    public static final Range DEFAULT_RANGE = new Range(0.0, 1.0);
081
082    /** The default auto-range value. */
083    public static final boolean DEFAULT_AUTO_RANGE = true;
084
085    /** The default inverted flag setting. */
086    public static final boolean DEFAULT_INVERTED = false;
087
088    /** The default minimum auto range. */
089    public static final double DEFAULT_AUTO_RANGE_MINIMUM_SIZE = 0.00000001;
090
091    /** The default value for the lower margin (0.05 = 5%). */
092    public static final double DEFAULT_LOWER_MARGIN = 0.05;
093
094    /** The default value for the upper margin (0.05 = 5%). */
095    public static final double DEFAULT_UPPER_MARGIN = 0.05;
096
097    /** The default auto-tick-unit-selection value. */
098    public static final boolean DEFAULT_AUTO_TICK_UNIT_SELECTION = true;
099
100    /** The maximum tick count. */
101    public static final int MAXIMUM_TICK_COUNT = 500;
102
103    /**
104     * A flag that controls whether an arrow is drawn at the positive end of
105     * the axis line.
106     */
107    private boolean positiveArrowVisible;
108
109    /**
110     * A flag that controls whether an arrow is drawn at the negative end of
111     * the axis line.
112     */
113    private boolean negativeArrowVisible;
114
115    /** A flag that affects the orientation of the values on the axis. */
116    private boolean inverted;
117
118    /** The axis range. */
119    private Range range;
120
121    /**
122     * Flag that indicates whether the axis automatically scales to fit the
123     * chart data.
124     */
125    private boolean autoRange;
126
127    /** The minimum size for the 'auto' axis range (excluding margins). */
128    private double autoRangeMinimumSize;
129
130    /**
131     * The default range is used when the dataset is empty and the axis needs
132     * to determine the auto range.
133     */
134    private Range defaultAutoRange;
135
136    /**
137     * The upper margin percentage.  This indicates the amount by which the
138     * maximum axis value exceeds the maximum data value (as a percentage of
139     * the range on the axis) when the axis range is determined automatically.
140     */
141    private double upperMargin;
142
143    /**
144     * The lower margin.  This is a percentage that indicates the amount by
145     * which the minimum axis value is "less than" the minimum data value when
146     * the axis range is determined automatically.
147     */
148    private double lowerMargin;
149
150    /**
151     * If this value is positive, the amount is subtracted from the maximum
152     * data value to determine the lower axis range.  This can be used to
153     * provide a fixed "window" on dynamic data.
154     */
155    private double fixedAutoRange;
156
157    /**
158     * Flag that indicates whether or not the tick unit is selected
159     * automatically.
160     */
161    private boolean autoTickUnitSelection;
162
163    /** The standard tick units for the axis. */
164    private TickUnitSource standardTickUnits;
165
166    /** An index into an array of standard tick values. */
167    private int autoTickIndex;
168
169    /**
170     * The number of minor ticks per major tick unit.  This is an override
171     * field, if the value is &gt; 0 it is used, otherwise the axis refers to the
172     * minorTickCount in the current tickUnit.
173     */
174    private int minorTickCount;
175
176    /** A flag indicating whether or not tick labels are rotated to vertical. */
177    private boolean verticalTickLabels;
178
179    /**
180     * Constructs a value axis.
181     *
182     * @param label  the axis label ({@code null} permitted).
183     * @param standardTickUnits  the source for standard tick units
184     *                           ({@code null} permitted).
185     */
186    protected ValueAxis(String label, TickUnitSource standardTickUnits) {
187
188        super(label);
189
190        this.positiveArrowVisible = false;
191        this.negativeArrowVisible = false;
192
193        this.range = DEFAULT_RANGE;
194        this.autoRange = DEFAULT_AUTO_RANGE;
195        this.defaultAutoRange = DEFAULT_RANGE;
196
197        this.inverted = DEFAULT_INVERTED;
198        this.autoRangeMinimumSize = DEFAULT_AUTO_RANGE_MINIMUM_SIZE;
199
200        this.lowerMargin = DEFAULT_LOWER_MARGIN;
201        this.upperMargin = DEFAULT_UPPER_MARGIN;
202
203        this.fixedAutoRange = 0.0;
204
205        this.autoTickUnitSelection = DEFAULT_AUTO_TICK_UNIT_SELECTION;
206        this.standardTickUnits = standardTickUnits;
207
208        Polygon p1 = new Polygon();
209        p1.addPoint(0, 0);
210        p1.addPoint(-2, 2);
211        p1.addPoint(2, 2);
212
213        valueAxisProduct.setUpArrow2(p1);
214
215        Polygon p2 = new Polygon();
216        p2.addPoint(0, 0);
217        p2.addPoint(-2, -2);
218        p2.addPoint(2, -2);
219
220        valueAxisProduct.setDownArrow2(p2);
221
222        Polygon p3 = new Polygon();
223        p3.addPoint(0, 0);
224        p3.addPoint(-2, -2);
225        p3.addPoint(-2, 2);
226
227        valueAxisProduct.setRightArrow2(p3);
228
229        Polygon p4 = new Polygon();
230        p4.addPoint(0, 0);
231        p4.addPoint(2, -2);
232        p4.addPoint(2, 2);
233
234        valueAxisProduct.setLeftArrow2(p4);
235
236        this.verticalTickLabels = false;
237        this.minorTickCount = 0;
238
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Returns {@code true} if the tick labels should be rotated (to
243     * vertical), and {@code false} otherwise.
244     *
245     * @return {@code true} or {@code false}.
246     *
247     * @see #setVerticalTickLabels(boolean)
248     */
249    public boolean isVerticalTickLabels() {
250        return this.verticalTickLabels;
251    }
252
253    /**
254     * Sets the flag that controls whether the tick labels are displayed
255     * vertically (that is, rotated 90 degrees from horizontal).  If the flag
256     * is changed, an {@link AxisChangeEvent} is sent to all registered
257     * listeners.
258     *
259     * @param flag  the flag.
260     *
261     * @see #isVerticalTickLabels()
262     */
263    public void setVerticalTickLabels(boolean flag) {
264        if (this.verticalTickLabels != flag) {
265            this.verticalTickLabels = flag;
266            fireChangeEvent();
267        }
268    }
269
270    /**
271     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not the axis line has an arrow
272     * drawn that points in the positive direction for the axis.
273     *
274     * @return A boolean.
275     *
276     * @see #setPositiveArrowVisible(boolean)
277     */
278    public boolean isPositiveArrowVisible() {
279        return this.positiveArrowVisible;
280    }
281
282    /**
283     * Sets a flag that controls whether or not the axis lines has an arrow
284     * drawn that points in the positive direction for the axis, and sends an
285     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
286     *
287     * @param visible  the flag.
288     *
289     * @see #isPositiveArrowVisible()
290     */
291    public void setPositiveArrowVisible(boolean visible) {
292        this.positiveArrowVisible = visible;
293        fireChangeEvent();
294    }
295
296    /**
297     * Returns a flag that controls whether or not the axis line has an arrow
298     * drawn that points in the negative direction for the axis.
299     *
300     * @return A boolean.
301     *
302     * @see #setNegativeArrowVisible(boolean)
303     */
304    public boolean isNegativeArrowVisible() {
305        return this.negativeArrowVisible;
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Sets a flag that controls whether or not the axis lines has an arrow
310     * drawn that points in the negative direction for the axis, and sends an
311     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
312     *
313     * @param visible  the flag.
314     *
315     * @see #setNegativeArrowVisible(boolean)
316     */
317    public void setNegativeArrowVisible(boolean visible) {
318        this.negativeArrowVisible = visible;
319        fireChangeEvent();
320    }
321
322    /**
323     * Returns a shape that can be displayed as an arrow pointing upwards at
324     * the end of an axis line.
325     *
326     * @return A shape (never {@code null}).
327     *
328     * @see #setUpArrow(Shape)
329     */
330    public Shape getUpArrow() {
331        return this.valueAxisProduct.getUpArrow();
332    }
333
334    /**
335     * Sets the shape that can be displayed as an arrow pointing upwards at
336     * the end of an axis line and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
337     * registered listeners.
338     *
339     * @param arrow  the arrow shape ({@code null} not permitted).
340     *
341     * @see #getUpArrow()
342     */
343    public void setUpArrow(Shape arrow) {
344        valueAxisProduct.setUpArrow(arrow, this);
345    }
346
347    /**
348     * Returns a shape that can be displayed as an arrow pointing downwards at
349     * the end of an axis line.
350     *
351     * @return A shape (never {@code null}).
352     *
353     * @see #setDownArrow(Shape)
354     */
355    public Shape getDownArrow() {
356        return this.valueAxisProduct.getDownArrow();
357    }
358
359    /**
360     * Sets the shape that can be displayed as an arrow pointing downwards at
361     * the end of an axis line and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
362     * registered listeners.
363     *
364     * @param arrow  the arrow shape ({@code null} not permitted).
365     *
366     * @see #getDownArrow()
367     */
368    public void setDownArrow(Shape arrow) {
369        valueAxisProduct.setDownArrow(arrow, this);
370    }
371
372    /**
373     * Returns a shape that can be displayed as an arrow pointing left at the
374     * end of an axis line.
375     *
376     * @return A shape (never {@code null}).
377     *
378     * @see #setLeftArrow(Shape)
379     */
380    public Shape getLeftArrow() {
381        return this.valueAxisProduct.getLeftArrow();
382    }
383
384    /**
385     * Sets the shape that can be displayed as an arrow pointing left at the
386     * end of an axis line and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
387     * registered listeners.
388     *
389     * @param arrow  the arrow shape ({@code null} not permitted).
390     *
391     * @see #getLeftArrow()
392     */
393    public void setLeftArrow(Shape arrow) {
394        valueAxisProduct.setLeftArrow(arrow, this);
395    }
396
397    /**
398     * Returns a shape that can be displayed as an arrow pointing right at the
399     * end of an axis line.
400     *
401     * @return A shape (never {@code null}).
402     *
403     * @see #setRightArrow(Shape)
404     */
405    public Shape getRightArrow() {
406        return this.valueAxisProduct.getRightArrow();
407    }
408
409    /**
410     * Sets the shape that can be displayed as an arrow pointing rightwards at
411     * the end of an axis line and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
412     * registered listeners.
413     *
414     * @param arrow  the arrow shape ({@code null} not permitted).
415     *
416     * @see #getRightArrow()
417     */
418    public void setRightArrow(Shape arrow) {
419        valueAxisProduct.setRightArrow(arrow, this);
420    }
421
422    /**
423     * Draws an axis line at the current cursor position and edge.
424     *
425     * @param g2  the graphics device ({@code null} not permitted).
426     * @param cursor  the cursor position.
427     * @param dataArea  the data area.
428     * @param edge  the edge.
429     */
430    @Override
431    protected void drawAxisLine(Graphics2D g2, double cursor,
432            Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge) {
433        Line2D axisLine = axisLine(cursor, dataArea, edge);
434                g2.setPaint(getAxisLinePaint());
435        g2.setStroke(getAxisLineStroke());
436        Object saved = g2.getRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL);
437        g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, 
438                RenderingHints.VALUE_STROKE_NORMALIZE);
439        g2.draw(axisLine);
440        g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, saved);
441
442        boolean drawUpOrRight = false;
443        boolean drawDownOrLeft = false;
444        if (this.positiveArrowVisible) {
445            if (this.inverted) {
446                drawDownOrLeft = true;
447            }
448            else {
449                drawUpOrRight = true;
450            }
451        }
452        if (this.negativeArrowVisible) {
453            if (this.inverted) {
454                drawUpOrRight = true;
455            } else {
456                drawDownOrLeft = true;
457            }
458        }
459        if (drawUpOrRight) {
460            double x = 0.0;
461            double y = 0.0;
462            Shape arrow = null;
463            if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP || edge == RectangleEdge.BOTTOM) {
464                x = dataArea.getMaxX();
465                y = cursor;
466                arrow = this.valueAxisProduct.getRightArrow();
467            } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT
468                    || edge == RectangleEdge.RIGHT) {
469                x = cursor;
470                y = dataArea.getMinY();
471                arrow = this.valueAxisProduct.getUpArrow();
472            }
473
474            // draw the arrow...
475            AffineTransform transformer = new AffineTransform();
476            transformer.setToTranslation(x, y);
477            Shape shape = transformer.createTransformedShape(arrow);
478            g2.fill(shape);
479            g2.draw(shape);
480        }
481
482        if (drawDownOrLeft) {
483            double x = 0.0;
484            double y = 0.0;
485            Shape arrow = null;
486            if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP || edge == RectangleEdge.BOTTOM) {
487                x = dataArea.getMinX();
488                y = cursor;
489                arrow = this.valueAxisProduct.getLeftArrow();
490            } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT
491                    || edge == RectangleEdge.RIGHT) {
492                x = cursor;
493                y = dataArea.getMaxY();
494                arrow = this.valueAxisProduct.getDownArrow();
495            }
496
497            // draw the arrow...
498            AffineTransform transformer = new AffineTransform();
499            transformer.setToTranslation(x, y);
500            Shape shape = transformer.createTransformedShape(arrow);
501            g2.fill(shape);
502            g2.draw(shape);
503        }
504
505    }
506
507        private Line2D axisLine(double cursor, Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge) {
508                Line2D axisLine = null;
509                double c = cursor;
510                if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP) {
511                        axisLine = new Line2D.Double(dataArea.getX(), c, dataArea.getMaxX(), c);
512                } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.BOTTOM) {
513                        axisLine = new Line2D.Double(dataArea.getX(), c, dataArea.getMaxX(), c);
514                } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT) {
515                        axisLine = new Line2D.Double(c, dataArea.getY(), c, dataArea.getMaxY());
516                } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.RIGHT) {
517                        axisLine = new Line2D.Double(c, dataArea.getY(), c, dataArea.getMaxY());
518                }
519                return axisLine;
520        }
521
522    /**
523     * Calculates the anchor point for a tick label.
524     *
525     * @param tick  the tick.
526     * @param cursor  the cursor.
527     * @param dataArea  the data area.
528     * @param edge  the edge on which the axis is drawn.
529     *
530     * @return The x and y coordinates of the anchor point.
531     */
532    protected float[] calculateAnchorPoint(ValueTick tick, double cursor,
533            Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge) {
534
535        RectangleInsets insets = getTickLabelInsets();
536        float[] result = new float[2];
537        if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP) {
538            result[0] = (float) valueToJava2D(tick.getValue(), dataArea, edge);
539            result[1] = (float) (cursor - insets.getBottom() - 2.0);
540        }
541        else if (edge == RectangleEdge.BOTTOM) {
542            result[0] = (float) valueToJava2D(tick.getValue(), dataArea, edge);
543            result[1] = (float) (cursor + insets.getTop() + 2.0);
544        }
545        else if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT) {
546            result[0] = (float) (cursor - insets.getLeft() - 2.0);
547            result[1] = (float) valueToJava2D(tick.getValue(), dataArea, edge);
548        }
549        else if (edge == RectangleEdge.RIGHT) {
550            result[0] = (float) (cursor + insets.getRight() + 2.0);
551            result[1] = (float) valueToJava2D(tick.getValue(), dataArea, edge);
552        }
553        return result;
554    }
555
556    /**
557     * Draws the axis line, tick marks and tick mark labels.
558     *
559     * @param g2  the graphics device ({@code null} not permitted).
560     * @param cursor  the cursor.
561     * @param plotArea  the plot area ({@code null} not permitted).
562     * @param dataArea  the data area ({@code null} not permitted).
563     * @param edge  the edge that the axis is aligned with ({@code null} 
564     *     not permitted).
565     *
566     * @return The width or height used to draw the axis.
567     */
568    protected AxisState drawTickMarksAndLabels(Graphics2D g2,
569            double cursor, Rectangle2D plotArea, Rectangle2D dataArea,
570            RectangleEdge edge) {
571
572        AxisState state = new AxisState(cursor);
573        if (isAxisLineVisible()) {
574            drawAxisLine(g2, cursor, dataArea, edge);
575        }
576        List ticks = refreshTicks(g2, state, dataArea, edge);
577        state.setTicks(ticks);
578        g2.setFont(getTickLabelFont());
579        Object saved = g2.getRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL);
580        g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, 
581                RenderingHints.VALUE_STROKE_NORMALIZE);
582        for (Object o : ticks) {
583            ValueTick tick = (ValueTick) o;
584            if (isTickLabelsVisible()) {
585                g2.setPaint(getTickLabelPaint());
586                float[] anchorPoint = calculateAnchorPoint(tick, cursor,
587                        dataArea, edge);
588                if (tick instanceof LogTick) {
589                    LogTick lt = (LogTick) tick;
590                    if (lt.getAttributedLabel() == null) {
591                        continue;
592                    }
593                    AttrStringUtils.drawRotatedString(lt.getAttributedLabel(),
594                            g2, anchorPoint[0], anchorPoint[1],
595                            tick.getTextAnchor(), tick.getAngle(),
596                            tick.getRotationAnchor());
597                } else {
598                    if (tick.getText() == null) {
599                        continue;
600                    }
601                    TextUtils.drawRotatedString(tick.getText(), g2,
602                            anchorPoint[0], anchorPoint[1],
603                            tick.getTextAnchor(), tick.getAngle(),
604                            tick.getRotationAnchor());
605                }
606            }
607
608            if ((isTickMarksVisible() && tick.getTickType().equals(
609                    TickType.MAJOR)) || (isMinorTickMarksVisible()
610                    && tick.getTickType().equals(TickType.MINOR))) {
611
612                Line2D mark = mark(cursor, dataArea, edge, tick);
613                                g2.setStroke(getTickMarkStroke());
614                g2.setPaint(getTickMarkPaint());
615                g2.draw(mark);
616            }
617        }
618        g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, saved);
619        
620        // need to work out the space used by the tick labels...
621        // so we can update the cursor...
622        double used = 0.0;
623        if (isTickLabelsVisible()) {
624            if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT) {
625                used += findMaximumTickLabelWidth(ticks, g2, plotArea,
626                        isVerticalTickLabels());
627                state.cursorLeft(used);
628            } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.RIGHT) {
629                used = findMaximumTickLabelWidth(ticks, g2, plotArea,
630                        isVerticalTickLabels());
631                state.cursorRight(used);
632            } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP) {
633                used = findMaximumTickLabelHeight(ticks, g2, plotArea,
634                        isVerticalTickLabels());
635                state.cursorUp(used);
636            } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.BOTTOM) {
637                used = findMaximumTickLabelHeight(ticks, g2, plotArea,
638                        isVerticalTickLabels());
639                state.cursorDown(used);
640            }
641        }
642
643        return state;
644    }
645
646        private Line2D mark(double cursor, Rectangle2D dataArea, RectangleEdge edge, ValueTick tick) {
647                double ol = (tick.getTickType().equals(TickType.MINOR)) ? getMinorTickMarkOutsideLength()
648                                : getTickMarkOutsideLength();
649                double il = (tick.getTickType().equals(TickType.MINOR)) ? getMinorTickMarkInsideLength()
650                                : getTickMarkInsideLength();
651                float xx = (float) valueToJava2D(tick.getValue(), dataArea, edge);
652                Line2D mark = null;
653                if (edge == RectangleEdge.LEFT) {
654                        mark = new Line2D.Double(cursor - ol, xx, cursor + il, xx);
655                } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.RIGHT) {
656                        mark = new Line2D.Double(cursor + ol, xx, cursor - il, xx);
657                } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.TOP) {
658                        mark = new Line2D.Double(xx, cursor - ol, xx, cursor + il);
659                } else if (edge == RectangleEdge.BOTTOM) {
660                        mark = new Line2D.Double(xx, cursor + ol, xx, cursor - il);
661                }
662                return mark;
663        }
664
665    /**
666     * Returns the space required to draw the axis.
667     *
668     * @param g2  the graphics device.
669     * @param plot  the plot that the axis belongs to.
670     * @param plotArea  the area within which the plot should be drawn.
671     * @param edge  the axis location.
672     * @param space  the space already reserved (for other axes).
673     *
674     * @return The space required to draw the axis (including pre-reserved
675     *         space).
676     */
677    @Override
678    public AxisSpace reserveSpace(Graphics2D g2, Plot plot, 
679            Rectangle2D plotArea, RectangleEdge edge, AxisSpace space) {
680
681        // create a new space object if one wasn't supplied...
682        if (space == null) {
683            space = new AxisSpace();
684        }
685
686        // if the axis is not visible, no additional space is required...
687        if (!isVisible()) {
688            return space;
689        }
690
691        // if the axis has a fixed dimension, return it...
692        double dimension = getFixedDimension();
693        if (dimension > 0.0) {
694            space.add(dimension, edge);
695            return space;
696        }
697
698        // calculate the max size of the tick labels (if visible)...
699        double tickLabelHeight = 0.0;
700        double tickLabelWidth = 0.0;
701        if (isTickLabelsVisible()) {
702            g2.setFont(getTickLabelFont());
703            List ticks = refreshTicks(g2, new AxisState(), plotArea, edge);
704            if (RectangleEdge.isTopOrBottom(edge)) {
705                tickLabelHeight = findMaximumTickLabelHeight(ticks, g2,
706                        plotArea, isVerticalTickLabels());
707            }
708            else if (RectangleEdge.isLeftOrRight(edge)) {
709                tickLabelWidth = findMaximumTickLabelWidth(ticks, g2, plotArea,
710                        isVerticalTickLabels());
711            }
712        }
713
714        // get the axis label size and update the space object...
715        Rectangle2D labelEnclosure = getLabelEnclosure(g2, edge);
716        if (RectangleEdge.isTopOrBottom(edge)) {
717            double labelHeight = labelEnclosure.getHeight();
718            space.add(labelHeight + tickLabelHeight, edge);
719        }
720        else if (RectangleEdge.isLeftOrRight(edge)) {
721            double labelWidth = labelEnclosure.getWidth();
722            space.add(labelWidth + tickLabelWidth, edge);
723        }
724
725        return space;
726
727    }
728
729    /**
730     * A utility method for determining the height of the tallest tick label.
731     *
732     * @param ticks  the ticks.
733     * @param g2  the graphics device.
734     * @param drawArea  the area within which the plot and axes should be drawn.
735     * @param vertical  a flag that indicates whether or not the tick labels
736     *                  are 'vertical'.
737     *
738     * @return The height of the tallest tick label.
739     */
740    protected double findMaximumTickLabelHeight(List ticks, Graphics2D g2,
741            Rectangle2D drawArea, boolean vertical) {
742
743        RectangleInsets insets = getTickLabelInsets();
744        Font font = getTickLabelFont();
745        g2.setFont(font);
746        double maxHeight = 0.0;
747        if (vertical) {
748            FontMetrics fm = g2.getFontMetrics(font);
749            for (Object o : ticks) {
750                Tick tick = (Tick) o;
751                Rectangle2D labelBounds = null;
752                if (tick instanceof LogTick) {
753                    LogTick lt = (LogTick) tick;
754                    if (lt.getAttributedLabel() != null) {
755                        labelBounds = AttrStringUtils.getTextBounds(
756                                lt.getAttributedLabel(), g2);
757                    }
758                } else if (tick.getText() != null) {
759                    labelBounds = TextUtils.getTextBounds(
760                            tick.getText(), g2, fm);
761                }
762                if (labelBounds != null && labelBounds.getWidth()
763                        + insets.getTop() + insets.getBottom() > maxHeight) {
764                    maxHeight = labelBounds.getWidth()
765                            + insets.getTop() + insets.getBottom();
766                }
767            }
768        } else {
769            LineMetrics metrics = font.getLineMetrics("ABCxyz",
770                    g2.getFontRenderContext());
771            maxHeight = metrics.getHeight()
772                        + insets.getTop() + insets.getBottom();
773        }
774        return maxHeight;
775
776    }
777
778    /**
779     * A utility method for determining the width of the widest tick label.
780     *
781     * @param ticks  the ticks.
782     * @param g2  the graphics device.
783     * @param drawArea  the area within which the plot and axes should be drawn.
784     * @param vertical  a flag that indicates whether or not the tick labels
785     *                  are 'vertical'.
786     *
787     * @return The width of the tallest tick label.
788     */
789    protected double findMaximumTickLabelWidth(List ticks, Graphics2D g2,
790            Rectangle2D drawArea, boolean vertical) {
791
792        RectangleInsets insets = getTickLabelInsets();
793        Font font = getTickLabelFont();
794        double maxWidth = 0.0;
795        if (!vertical) {
796            FontMetrics fm = g2.getFontMetrics(font);
797            for (Object o : ticks) {
798                Tick tick = (Tick) o;
799                Rectangle2D labelBounds = null;
800                if (tick instanceof LogTick) {
801                    LogTick lt = (LogTick) tick;
802                    if (lt.getAttributedLabel() != null) {
803                        labelBounds = AttrStringUtils.getTextBounds(
804                                lt.getAttributedLabel(), g2);
805                    }
806                } else if (tick.getText() != null) {
807                    labelBounds = TextUtils.getTextBounds(tick.getText(),
808                            g2, fm);
809                }
810                if (labelBounds != null
811                        && labelBounds.getWidth() + insets.getLeft()
812                        + insets.getRight() > maxWidth) {
813                    maxWidth = labelBounds.getWidth()
814                            + insets.getLeft() + insets.getRight();
815                }
816            }
817        } else {
818            LineMetrics metrics = font.getLineMetrics("ABCxyz",
819                    g2.getFontRenderContext());
820            maxWidth = metrics.getHeight()
821                       + insets.getTop() + insets.getBottom();
822        }
823        return maxWidth;
824
825    }
826
827    /**
828     * Returns a flag that controls the direction of values on the axis.
829     * <P>
830     * For a regular axis, values increase from left to right (for a horizontal
831     * axis) and bottom to top (for a vertical axis).  When the axis is
832     * 'inverted', the values increase in the opposite direction.
833     *
834     * @return The flag.
835     *
836     * @see #setInverted(boolean)
837     */
838    public boolean isInverted() {
839        return this.inverted;
840    }
841
842    /**
843     * Sets a flag that controls the direction of values on the axis, and
844     * notifies registered listeners that the axis has changed.
845     *
846     * @param flag  the flag.
847     *
848     * @see #isInverted()
849     */
850    public void setInverted(boolean flag) {
851        if (this.inverted != flag) {
852            this.inverted = flag;
853            fireChangeEvent();
854        }
855    }
856
857    /**
858     * Returns the flag that controls whether or not the axis range is
859     * automatically adjusted to fit the data values.
860     *
861     * @return The flag.
862     *
863     * @see #setAutoRange(boolean)
864     */
865    public boolean isAutoRange() {
866        return this.autoRange;
867    }
868
869    /**
870     * Sets a flag that determines whether or not the axis range is
871     * automatically adjusted to fit the data, and notifies registered
872     * listeners that the axis has been modified.
873     *
874     * @param auto  the new value of the flag.
875     *
876     * @see #isAutoRange()
877     */
878    public void setAutoRange(boolean auto) {
879        setAutoRange(auto, true);
880    }
881
882    /**
883     * Sets the auto range attribute.  If the {@code notify} flag is set,
884     * an {@link AxisChangeEvent} is sent to registered listeners.
885     *
886     * @param auto  the flag.
887     * @param notify  notify listeners?
888     *
889     * @see #isAutoRange()
890     */
891    protected void setAutoRange(boolean auto, boolean notify) {
892        this.autoRange = auto;
893        if (this.autoRange) {
894            autoAdjustRange();
895        }
896        if (notify) {
897            fireChangeEvent();
898        }
899    }
900
901    /**
902     * Returns the minimum size allowed for the axis range when it is
903     * automatically calculated.
904     *
905     * @return The minimum range.
906     *
907     * @see #setAutoRangeMinimumSize(double)
908     */
909    public double getAutoRangeMinimumSize() {
910        return this.autoRangeMinimumSize;
911    }
912
913    /**
914     * Sets the auto range minimum size and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent}
915     * to all registered listeners.
916     *
917     * @param size  the size.
918     *
919     * @see #getAutoRangeMinimumSize()
920     */
921    public void setAutoRangeMinimumSize(double size) {
922        setAutoRangeMinimumSize(size, true);
923    }
924
925    /**
926     * Sets the minimum size allowed for the axis range when it is
927     * automatically calculated.
928     * <p>
929     * If requested, an {@link AxisChangeEvent} is forwarded to all registered
930     * listeners.
931     *
932     * @param size  the new minimum.
933     * @param notify  notify listeners?
934     */
935    public void setAutoRangeMinimumSize(double size, boolean notify) {
936        if (size <= 0.0) {
937            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
938                "NumberAxis.setAutoRangeMinimumSize(double): must be > 0.0.");
939        }
940        if (this.autoRangeMinimumSize != size) {
941            this.autoRangeMinimumSize = size;
942            if (this.autoRange) {
943                autoAdjustRange();
944            }
945            if (notify) {
946                fireChangeEvent();
947            }
948        }
949
950    }
951
952    /**
953     * Returns the default auto range.
954     *
955     * @return The default auto range (never {@code null}).
956     *
957     * @see #setDefaultAutoRange(Range)
958     */
959    public Range getDefaultAutoRange() {
960        return this.defaultAutoRange;
961    }
962
963    /**
964     * Sets the default auto range and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
965     * registered listeners.
966     *
967     * @param range  the range ({@code null} not permitted).
968     *
969     * @see #getDefaultAutoRange()
970     */
971    public void setDefaultAutoRange(Range range) {
972        Args.nullNotPermitted(range, "range");
973        this.defaultAutoRange = range;
974        fireChangeEvent();
975    }
976
977    /**
978     * Returns the lower margin for the axis, expressed as a percentage of the
979     * axis range.  This controls the space added to the lower end of the axis
980     * when the axis range is automatically calculated (it is ignored when the
981     * axis range is set explicitly). The default value is 0.05 (five percent).
982     *
983     * @return The lower margin.
984     *
985     * @see #setLowerMargin(double)
986     */
987    public double getLowerMargin() {
988        return this.lowerMargin;
989    }
990
991    /**
992     * Sets the lower margin for the axis (as a percentage of the axis range)
993     * and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  This
994     * margin is added only when the axis range is auto-calculated - if you set
995     * the axis range manually, the margin is ignored.
996     *
997     * @param margin  the margin percentage (for example, 0.05 is five percent).
998     *
999     * @see #getLowerMargin()
1000     * @see #setUpperMargin(double)
1001     */
1002    public void setLowerMargin(double margin) {
1003        this.lowerMargin = margin;
1004        if (isAutoRange()) {
1005            autoAdjustRange();
1006        }
1007        fireChangeEvent();
1008    }
1009
1010    /**
1011     * Returns the upper margin for the axis, expressed as a percentage of the
1012     * axis range.  This controls the space added to the lower end of the axis
1013     * when the axis range is automatically calculated (it is ignored when the
1014     * axis range is set explicitly). The default value is 0.05 (five percent).
1015     *
1016     * @return The upper margin.
1017     *
1018     * @see #setUpperMargin(double)
1019     */
1020    public double getUpperMargin() {
1021        return this.upperMargin;
1022    }
1023
1024    /**
1025     * Sets the upper margin for the axis (as a percentage of the axis range)
1026     * and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  This
1027     * margin is added only when the axis range is auto-calculated - if you set
1028     * the axis range manually, the margin is ignored.
1029     *
1030     * @param margin  the margin percentage (for example, 0.05 is five percent).
1031     *
1032     * @see #getLowerMargin()
1033     * @see #setLowerMargin(double)
1034     */
1035    public void setUpperMargin(double margin) {
1036        this.upperMargin = margin;
1037        if (isAutoRange()) {
1038            autoAdjustRange();
1039        }
1040        fireChangeEvent();
1041    }
1042
1043    /**
1044     * Returns the fixed auto range.
1045     *
1046     * @return The length.
1047     *
1048     * @see #setFixedAutoRange(double)
1049     */
1050    public double getFixedAutoRange() {
1051        return this.fixedAutoRange;
1052    }
1053
1054    /**
1055     * Sets the fixed auto range for the axis.
1056     *
1057     * @param length  the range length.
1058     *
1059     * @see #getFixedAutoRange()
1060     */
1061    public void setFixedAutoRange(double length) {
1062        this.fixedAutoRange = length;
1063        if (isAutoRange()) {
1064            autoAdjustRange();
1065        }
1066        fireChangeEvent();
1067    }
1068
1069    /**
1070     * Returns the lower bound of the axis range.
1071     *
1072     * @return The lower bound.
1073     *
1074     * @see #setLowerBound(double)
1075     */
1076    public double getLowerBound() {
1077        return this.range.getLowerBound();
1078    }
1079
1080    /**
1081     * Sets the lower bound for the axis range.  An {@link AxisChangeEvent} is
1082     * sent to all registered listeners.
1083     *
1084     * @param min  the new minimum.
1085     *
1086     * @see #getLowerBound()
1087     */
1088    public void setLowerBound(double min) {
1089        if (this.range.getUpperBound() > min) {
1090            setRange(new Range(min, this.range.getUpperBound()));
1091        }
1092        else {
1093            setRange(new Range(min, min + 1.0));
1094        }
1095    }
1096
1097    /**
1098     * Returns the upper bound for the axis range.
1099     *
1100     * @return The upper bound.
1101     *
1102     * @see #setUpperBound(double)
1103     */
1104    public double getUpperBound() {
1105        return this.range.getUpperBound();
1106    }
1107
1108    /**
1109     * Sets the upper bound for the axis range, and sends an
1110     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
1111     *
1112     * @param max  the new maximum.
1113     *
1114     * @see #getUpperBound()
1115     */
1116    public void setUpperBound(double max) {
1117        if (this.range.getLowerBound() < max) {
1118            setRange(new Range(this.range.getLowerBound(), max));
1119        }
1120        else {
1121            setRange(max - 1.0, max);
1122        }
1123    }
1124
1125    /**
1126     * Returns the range for the axis.
1127     *
1128     * @return The axis range (never {@code null}).
1129     *
1130     * @see #setRange(Range)
1131     */
1132    public Range getRange() {
1133        return this.range;
1134    }
1135
1136    /**
1137     * Sets the range for the axis and sends a change event to all registered 
1138     * listeners.  As a side-effect, the auto-range flag is set to
1139     * {@code false}.
1140     *
1141     * @param range  the range ({@code null} not permitted).
1142     *
1143     * @see #getRange()
1144     */
1145    public void setRange(Range range) {
1146        // defer argument checking
1147        setRange(range, true, true);
1148    }
1149
1150    /**
1151     * Sets the range for the axis and, if requested, sends a change event to 
1152     * all registered listeners.  Furthermore, if {@code turnOffAutoRange}
1153     * is {@code true}, the auto-range flag is set to {@code false} 
1154     * (normally when setting the axis range manually the caller expects that
1155     * range to remain in force).
1156     *
1157     * @param range  the range ({@code null} not permitted).
1158     * @param turnOffAutoRange  a flag that controls whether or not the auto
1159     *                          range is turned off.
1160     * @param notify  a flag that controls whether or not listeners are
1161     *                notified.
1162     *
1163     * @see #getRange()
1164     */
1165    public void setRange(Range range, boolean turnOffAutoRange, 
1166            boolean notify) {
1167        Args.nullNotPermitted(range, "range");
1168        if (range.getLength() <= 0.0) {
1169            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1170                    "A positive range length is required: " + range);
1171        }
1172        if (turnOffAutoRange) {
1173            this.autoRange = false;
1174        }
1175        this.range = range;
1176        if (notify) {
1177            fireChangeEvent();
1178        }
1179    }
1180
1181    /**
1182     * Sets the range for the axis and sends a change event to all registered 
1183     * listeners.  As a side-effect, the auto-range flag is set to
1184     * {@code false}.
1185     *
1186     * @param lower  the lower axis limit.
1187     * @param upper  the upper axis limit.
1188     *
1189     * @see #getRange()
1190     * @see #setRange(Range)
1191     */
1192    public void setRange(double lower, double upper) {
1193        setRange(new Range(lower, upper));
1194    }
1195
1196    /**
1197     * Sets the range for the axis (after first adding the current margins to
1198     * the specified range) and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
1199     * registered listeners.
1200     *
1201     * @param range  the range ({@code null} not permitted).
1202     */
1203    public void setRangeWithMargins(Range range) {
1204        setRangeWithMargins(range, true, true);
1205    }
1206
1207    /**
1208     * Sets the range for the axis after first adding the current margins to
1209     * the range and, if requested, sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
1210     * registered listeners.  As a side-effect, the auto-range flag is set to
1211     * {@code false} (optional).
1212     *
1213     * @param range  the range (excluding margins, {@code null} not
1214     *               permitted).
1215     * @param turnOffAutoRange  a flag that controls whether or not the auto
1216     *                          range is turned off.
1217     * @param notify  a flag that controls whether or not listeners are
1218     *                notified.
1219     */
1220    public void setRangeWithMargins(Range range, boolean turnOffAutoRange,
1221                                    boolean notify) {
1222        Args.nullNotPermitted(range, "range");
1223        setRange(Range.expand(range, getLowerMargin(), getUpperMargin()),
1224                turnOffAutoRange, notify);
1225    }
1226
1227    /**
1228     * Sets the axis range (after first adding the current margins to the
1229     * range) and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
1230     * As a side-effect, the auto-range flag is set to {@code false}.
1231     *
1232     * @param lower  the lower axis limit.
1233     * @param upper  the upper axis limit.
1234     */
1235    public void setRangeWithMargins(double lower, double upper) {
1236        setRangeWithMargins(new Range(lower, upper));
1237    }
1238
1239    /**
1240     * Sets the axis range, where the new range is 'size' in length, and
1241     * centered on 'value'.
1242     *
1243     * @param value  the central value.
1244     * @param length  the range length.
1245     */
1246    public void setRangeAboutValue(double value, double length) {
1247        setRange(new Range(value - length / 2, value + length / 2));
1248    }
1249
1250    /**
1251     * Returns a flag indicating whether or not the tick unit is automatically
1252     * selected from a range of standard tick units.
1253     *
1254     * @return A flag indicating whether or not the tick unit is automatically
1255     *         selected.
1256     *
1257     * @see #setAutoTickUnitSelection(boolean)
1258     */
1259    public boolean isAutoTickUnitSelection() {
1260        return this.autoTickUnitSelection;
1261    }
1262
1263    /**
1264     * Sets a flag indicating whether or not the tick unit is automatically
1265     * selected from a range of standard tick units.  If the flag is changed,
1266     * registered listeners are notified that the chart has changed.
1267     *
1268     * @param flag  the new value of the flag.
1269     *
1270     * @see #isAutoTickUnitSelection()
1271     */
1272    public void setAutoTickUnitSelection(boolean flag) {
1273        setAutoTickUnitSelection(flag, true);
1274    }
1275
1276    /**
1277     * Sets a flag indicating whether or not the tick unit is automatically
1278     * selected from a range of standard tick units.
1279     *
1280     * @param flag  the new value of the flag.
1281     * @param notify  notify listeners?
1282     *
1283     * @see #isAutoTickUnitSelection()
1284     */
1285    public void setAutoTickUnitSelection(boolean flag, boolean notify) {
1286
1287        if (this.autoTickUnitSelection != flag) {
1288            this.autoTickUnitSelection = flag;
1289            if (notify) {
1290                fireChangeEvent();
1291            }
1292        }
1293    }
1294
1295    /**
1296     * Returns the source for obtaining standard tick units for the axis.
1297     *
1298     * @return The source (possibly {@code null}).
1299     *
1300     * @see #setStandardTickUnits(TickUnitSource)
1301     */
1302    public TickUnitSource getStandardTickUnits() {
1303        return this.standardTickUnits;
1304    }
1305
1306    /**
1307     * Sets the source for obtaining standard tick units for the axis and sends
1308     * an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.  The axis will
1309     * try to select the smallest tick unit from the source that does not cause
1310     * the tick labels to overlap (see also the
1311     * {@link #setAutoTickUnitSelection(boolean)} method.
1312     *
1313     * @param source  the source for standard tick units ({@code null}
1314     *                permitted).
1315     *
1316     * @see #getStandardTickUnits()
1317     */
1318    public void setStandardTickUnits(TickUnitSource source) {
1319        this.standardTickUnits = source;
1320        fireChangeEvent();
1321    }
1322
1323    /**
1324     * Returns the number of minor tick marks to display.
1325     *
1326     * @return The number of minor tick marks to display.
1327     *
1328     * @see #setMinorTickCount(int)
1329     */
1330    public int getMinorTickCount() {
1331        return this.minorTickCount;
1332    }
1333
1334    /**
1335     * Sets the number of minor tick marks to display, and sends an
1336     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
1337     *
1338     * @param count  the count.
1339     *
1340     * @see #getMinorTickCount()
1341     */
1342    public void setMinorTickCount(int count) {
1343        this.minorTickCount = count;
1344        fireChangeEvent();
1345    }
1346
1347    /**
1348     * Converts a data value to a coordinate in Java2D space, assuming that the
1349     * axis runs along one edge of the specified dataArea.
1350     * <p>
1351     * Note that it is possible for the coordinate to fall outside the area.
1352     *
1353     * @param value  the data value.
1354     * @param area  the area for plotting the data.
1355     * @param edge  the edge along which the axis lies.
1356     *
1357     * @return The Java2D coordinate.
1358     *
1359     * @see #java2DToValue(double, Rectangle2D, RectangleEdge)
1360     */
1361    public abstract double valueToJava2D(double value, Rectangle2D area,
1362                                         RectangleEdge edge);
1363
1364    /**
1365     * Converts a length in data coordinates into the corresponding length in
1366     * Java2D coordinates.
1367     *
1368     * @param length  the length.
1369     * @param area  the plot area.
1370     * @param edge  the edge along which the axis lies.
1371     *
1372     * @return The length in Java2D coordinates.
1373     */
1374    public double lengthToJava2D(double length, Rectangle2D area,
1375                                 RectangleEdge edge) {
1376        double zero = valueToJava2D(0.0, area, edge);
1377        double l = valueToJava2D(length, area, edge);
1378        return Math.abs(l - zero);
1379    }
1380
1381    /**
1382     * Converts a coordinate in Java2D space to the corresponding data value,
1383     * assuming that the axis runs along one edge of the specified dataArea.
1384     *
1385     * @param java2DValue  the coordinate in Java2D space.
1386     * @param area  the area in which the data is plotted.
1387     * @param edge  the edge along which the axis lies.
1388     *
1389     * @return The data value.
1390     *
1391     * @see #valueToJava2D(double, Rectangle2D, RectangleEdge)
1392     */
1393    public abstract double java2DToValue(double java2DValue, Rectangle2D area, 
1394            RectangleEdge edge);
1395
1396    /**
1397     * Automatically sets the axis range to fit the range of values in the
1398     * dataset.  Sometimes this can depend on the renderer used as well (for
1399     * example, the renderer may "stack" values, requiring an axis range
1400     * greater than otherwise necessary).
1401     */
1402    protected abstract void autoAdjustRange();
1403
1404    /**
1405     * Centers the axis range about the specified value and sends an
1406     * {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
1407     *
1408     * @param value  the center value.
1409     */
1410    public void centerRange(double value) {
1411        double central = this.range.getCentralValue();
1412        Range adjusted = new Range(this.range.getLowerBound() + value - central,
1413                this.range.getUpperBound() + value - central);
1414        setRange(adjusted);
1415    }
1416
1417    /**
1418     * Increases or decreases the axis range by the specified percentage about
1419     * the central value and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all registered
1420     * listeners.
1421     * <P>
1422     * To double the length of the axis range, use 200% (2.0).
1423     * To halve the length of the axis range, use 50% (0.5).
1424     *
1425     * @param percent  the resize factor.
1426     *
1427     * @see #resizeRange(double, double)
1428     */
1429    public void resizeRange(double percent) {
1430        resizeRange(percent, this.range.getCentralValue());
1431    }
1432
1433    /**
1434     * Increases or decreases the axis range by the specified percentage about
1435     * the specified anchor value and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
1436     * registered listeners.
1437     * <P>
1438     * To double the length of the axis range, use 200% (2.0).
1439     * To halve the length of the axis range, use 50% (0.5).
1440     *
1441     * @param percent  the resize factor.
1442     * @param anchorValue  the new central value after the resize.
1443     *
1444     * @see #resizeRange(double)
1445     */
1446    public void resizeRange(double percent, double anchorValue) {
1447        if (percent > 0.0) {
1448            double halfLength = this.range.getLength() * percent / 2;
1449            Range adjusted = new Range(anchorValue - halfLength,
1450                    anchorValue + halfLength);
1451            setRange(adjusted);
1452        }
1453        else {
1454            setAutoRange(true);
1455        }
1456    }
1457
1458    /**
1459     * Increases or decreases the axis range by the specified percentage about
1460     * the specified anchor value and sends an {@link AxisChangeEvent} to all
1461     * registered listeners.
1462     * <P>
1463     * To double the length of the axis range, use 200% (2.0).
1464     * To halve the length of the axis range, use 50% (0.5).
1465     *
1466     * @param percent  the resize factor.
1467     * @param anchorValue  the new central value after the resize.
1468     *
1469     * @see #resizeRange(double)
1470     */
1471    public void resizeRange2(double percent, double anchorValue) {
1472        if (percent > 0.0) {
1473            double left = anchorValue - getLowerBound();
1474            double right = getUpperBound() - anchorValue;
1475            Range adjusted = new Range(anchorValue - left * percent,
1476                    anchorValue + right * percent);
1477            setRange(adjusted);
1478        }
1479        else {
1480            setAutoRange(true);
1481        }
1482    }
1483
1484    /**
1485     * Zooms in on the current range.
1486     *
1487     * @param lowerPercent  the new lower bound.
1488     * @param upperPercent  the new upper bound.
1489     */
1490    public void zoomRange(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent) {
1491        double start = this.range.getLowerBound();
1492        double length = this.range.getLength();
1493        double r0, r1;
1494        if (isInverted()) {
1495            r0 = start + (length * (1 - upperPercent));
1496            r1 = start + (length * (1 - lowerPercent));
1497        }
1498        else {
1499            r0 = start + length * lowerPercent;
1500            r1 = start + length * upperPercent;
1501        }
1502        if ((r1 > r0) && !Double.isInfinite(r1 - r0)) {
1503            setRange(new Range(r0, r1));
1504        }
1505    }
1506
1507    /**
1508     * Slides the axis range by the specified percentage.
1509     *
1510     * @param percent  the percentage.
1511     */
1512    public void pan(double percent) {
1513        Range r = getRange();
1514        double length = range.getLength();
1515        double adj = length * percent;
1516        double lower = r.getLowerBound() + adj;
1517        double upper = r.getUpperBound() + adj;
1518        setRange(lower, upper);
1519    }
1520
1521    /**
1522     * Returns the auto tick index.
1523     *
1524     * @return The auto tick index.
1525     *
1526     * @see #setAutoTickIndex(int)
1527     */
1528    protected int getAutoTickIndex() {
1529        return this.autoTickIndex;
1530    }
1531
1532    /**
1533     * Sets the auto tick index.
1534     *
1535     * @param index  the new value.
1536     *
1537     * @see #getAutoTickIndex()
1538     */
1539    protected void setAutoTickIndex(int index) {
1540        this.autoTickIndex = index;
1541    }
1542
1543    /**
1544     * Tests the axis for equality with an arbitrary object.
1545     *
1546     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
1547     *
1548     * @return {@code true} or {@code false}.
1549     */
1550    @Override
1551    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1552        if (obj == this) {
1553            return true;
1554        }
1555        if (!(obj instanceof ValueAxis)) {
1556            return false;
1557        }
1558        ValueAxis that = (ValueAxis) obj;
1559        if (this.positiveArrowVisible != that.positiveArrowVisible) {
1560            return false;
1561        }
1562        if (this.negativeArrowVisible != that.negativeArrowVisible) {
1563            return false;
1564        }
1565        if (this.inverted != that.inverted) {
1566            return false;
1567        }
1568        // if autoRange is true, then the current range is irrelevant
1569        if (!this.autoRange && !Objects.equals(this.range, that.range)) {
1570            return false;
1571        }
1572        if (this.autoRange != that.autoRange) {
1573            return false;
1574        }
1575        if (this.autoRangeMinimumSize != that.autoRangeMinimumSize) {
1576            return false;
1577        }
1578        if (!this.defaultAutoRange.equals(that.defaultAutoRange)) {
1579            return false;
1580        }
1581        if (this.upperMargin != that.upperMargin) {
1582            return false;
1583        }
1584        if (this.lowerMargin != that.lowerMargin) {
1585            return false;
1586        }
1587        if (this.fixedAutoRange != that.fixedAutoRange) {
1588            return false;
1589        }
1590        if (this.autoTickUnitSelection != that.autoTickUnitSelection) {
1591            return false;
1592        }
1593        if (!Objects.equals(this.standardTickUnits, that.standardTickUnits)) {
1594            return false;
1595        }
1596        if (this.verticalTickLabels != that.verticalTickLabels) {
1597            return false;
1598        }
1599        if (this.minorTickCount != that.minorTickCount) {
1600            return false;
1601        }
1602        return super.equals(obj);
1603    }
1604
1605    /**
1606     * Returns a clone of the object.
1607     *
1608     * @return A clone.
1609     *
1610     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException if some component of the axis does
1611     *         not support cloning.
1612     */
1613    @Override
1614    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
1615        ValueAxis clone = (ValueAxis) super.clone();
1616                clone.valueAxisProduct = (ValueAxisProduct) this.valueAxisProduct.clone();
1617        return clone;
1618    }
1619
1620    /**
1621     * Provides serialization support.
1622     *
1623     * @param stream  the output stream.
1624     *
1625     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1626     */
1627    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1628        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1629                stream.writeObject(this.valueAxisProduct);
1630        SerialUtils.writeShape(this.valueAxisProduct.getUpArrow(), stream);
1631        SerialUtils.writeShape(this.valueAxisProduct.getDownArrow(), stream);
1632        SerialUtils.writeShape(this.valueAxisProduct.getLeftArrow(), stream);
1633        SerialUtils.writeShape(this.valueAxisProduct.getRightArrow(), stream);
1634    }
1635
1636    /**
1637     * Provides serialization support.
1638     *
1639     * @param stream  the input stream.
1640     *
1641     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1642     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1643     */
1644    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
1645            throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
1646
1647        stream.defaultReadObject();
1648                this.valueAxisProduct = (ValueAxisProduct) stream.readObject();
1649        valueAxisProduct.setUpArrow2(SerialUtils.readShape(stream));
1650        valueAxisProduct.setDownArrow2(SerialUtils.readShape(stream));
1651        valueAxisProduct.setLeftArrow2(SerialUtils.readShape(stream));
1652        valueAxisProduct.setRightArrow2(SerialUtils.readShape(stream));
1653    }
1654
1655}
